SEARCH
Package org.view

Interface ComponentGenerator

All Known Implementing Classes:
SwingComponentGenerator
public interface ComponentGenerator
Interface for generating and managing UI components in a game. This interface provides methods to create, modify, and display various UI elements such as buttons, labels, and game fields. It also includes methods for painting backgrounds and boards, as well as handling user interactions.

  • Method Details

    • dispose

      void dispose()

    • modifyButtonText

      void modifyButtonText(int ID, String text)
      Modifies the text of a button with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the button to modify
      text - the new text for the button

    • modifyLabelText

      void modifyLabelText(int ID, String text)
      Modifies the text of a label with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the label to modify
      text - the new text for the label

    • updateFieldGraphic

      void updateFieldGraphic(List<Integer> fieldList, ComponentGenerator.FieldType type)
      Updates the graphical representation of fields on the game board. This method can update multiple fields at once or a single field based on the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      fieldList - A list of field indices to update.
      type - The type to set for the specified fields.

    • updateFieldGraphic

      void updateFieldGraphic(int field, ComponentGenerator.FieldType type)
      Updates the graphical representation of a single field on the game board.
      Parameters:
      field - The index of the field to update.
      type - The type to set for the specified field.

    • generateBase

      void generateBase(int x, int y)
      Generates the base layout for the UI components with the specified width and height.
      Parameters:
      x - The width of the base layout.
      y - The height of the base layout.

    • paintBackground

      void paintBackground(int rectX1, int rectY1, int rectX2, int rectY2, int fillX1, int fillY1, int fillX2, int fillY2, ComponentGenerator.Color color1, ComponentGenerator.Color color2, int layer)
      Paints the background of a specified rectangle area with a gradient fill.
      Parameters:
      rectX1 - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
      rectY1 - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
      rectX2 - The x-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangle.
      rectY2 - The y-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangle.
      fillX1 - The x-coordinate where the gradient fill starts.
      fillY1 - The y-coordinate where the gradient fill starts.
      fillX2 - The x-coordinate where the gradient fill ends.
      fillY2 - The y-coordinate where the gradient fill ends.
      color1 - The starting color of the gradient.
      color2 - The ending color of the gradient.
      layer - The layer on which to paint the background (higher layers are drawn on top).

    • paintBoard

      void paintBoard(int rectX1, int rectY1, int rectX2, int rectY2, int fillX1, int fillY1, int fillX2, int fillY2, ComponentGenerator.Color color1, ComponentGenerator.Color color2, MapModel mapModel, int layer, Consumer<Integer> callback)
      Paints the game board with specified properties.
      Parameters:
      rectX1 - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle area to paint.
      rectY1 - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle area to paint.
      rectX2 - The x-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangle area to paint.
      rectY2 - The y-coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the rectangle area to paint.
      fillX1 - The x-coordinate where the gradient fill starts.
      fillY1 - The y-coordinate where the gradient fill starts.
      fillX2 - The x-coordinate where the gradient fill ends.
      fillY2 - The y-coordinate where the gradient fill ends.
      color1 - The starting color of the gradient.
      color2 - The ending color of the gradient.
      mapModel - The model representing the game map to be painted.
      layer - The layer on which to paint the board (higher layers are drawn on top).
      callback - A callback function that receives an integer ID after painting is complete.

    • addUITestGif

      void addUITestGif()
      For UI testing purposes only. Adds a test GIF to the UI. This method is intended for development and testing of the UI components.

    • addLabel

      int addLabel(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height, int size, ComponentGenerator.HorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment, ComponentGenerator.VerticalAlignment verticalAlignment, int layer)
      Adds a label to the UI with specified properties.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to display on the label.
      x - The x-coordinate of the label's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the label's position.
      width - The width of the label.
      height - The height of the label.
      size - The font size of the label text.
      horizontalAlignment - The horizontal alignment of the text within the label (LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT).
      verticalAlignment - The vertical alignment of the text within the label (TOP, MIDDLE, BOTTOM).
      layer - The layer on which to add the label (higher layers are drawn on top).
      Returns:
      The ID of the added label component.

    • addButton

      int addButton(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height, Runnable callback, int layer)
      Adds a button to the UI with specified properties.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to display on the button.
      x - The x-coordinate of the button's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the button's position.
      width - The width of the button.
      height - The height of the button.
      callback - A callback function to be executed when the button is clicked.
      layer - The layer on which to add the button (higher layers are drawn on top).
      Returns:
      The ID of the added button component.

    • addComboBox

      <T> int addComboBox(T[] items, T selectedItem, int x, int y, int width, int height, Consumer<String> callback, int layer)
      Adds a combo box (drop-down list) to the UI with specified properties.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of items in the combo box (e.g., String, Integer).
      Parameters:
      items - An array of items to display in the combo box.
      selectedItem - The item that should be selected by default.
      x - The x-coordinate of the combo box's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the combo box's position.
      width - The width of the combo box.
      height - The height of the combo box.
      callback - A callback function that receives the selected item as a string when the selection changes.
      layer - The layer on which to add the combo box (higher layers are drawn on top).
      Returns:
      The ID of the added combo box component.

    • modifyStack

      void modifyStack(int ID, int unit1, ComponentGenerator.Color color1, int unit2, ComponentGenerator.Color color2)
      Modifies the properties of an existing stack of game pieces. This method allows updating the number of pieces and their colors in the stack.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the stack component to modify.
      unit1 - The new number of pieces for the first color.
      color1 - The color of the first set of pieces.
      unit2 - The new number of pieces for the second color.
      color2 - The color of the second set of pieces.

    • drawStack

      int drawStack(int x, int y, int width, int height, int gap, int unit, ComponentGenerator.Color color, int layer, boolean isCorrectPlayer)
      Draws a stack of game pieces at the specified location with given properties. Each piece in the stack is represented as a rectangle, and the pieces are drawn with a specified gap between them. If it is the current player's stack, it is drawn with a border to indicate ownership.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the stack's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the stack's position.
      width - The width of the stack.
      height - The height of the stack.
      gap - The gap between individual pieces in the stack.
      unit - The number of pieces in the stack.
      color - The color of the pieces in the stack.
      layer - The layer on which to draw the stack (higher layers are drawn on top).
      isCorrectPlayer - Indicates if the stack belongs to the current player (true) or the opponent (false).
      Returns:
      The ID of the drawn stack component.

    • show

      void show()
      Shows the UI components managed by this generator. This method makes the components visible on the screen.

    • hide

      void hide()
      Hides the UI components managed by this generator. This method makes the components invisible on the screen.

    • copy

      ComponentGenerator copy()
      Creates and returns a copy of this ComponentGenerator instance. This method is useful for creating separate instances with the same configuration.
      Returns:
      A new ComponentGenerator instance that is a copy of this one.
